p.Open to College of Business students maj: Open to College of Business students majoring in Accounting, Economics, and Finance and College of Engineering & Computer Science students.
p.Program participants will acquire compet: Program participants will acquire competence in computer programming skills for use in data analytics and specific knowledge of FinTech to meet the growing demands for such services.

li.Completion of FIN 3403 with a \"B\" or b: Completion of FIN 3403 with a "B" or better prior to application to the minor.

courseSection0.text:
Open to College of Business students majoring in Accounting, Economics, and Finance and College of Engineering & Computer Science students.
Program participants will acquire competence in computer programming skills for use in data analytics and specific knowledge of FinTech to meet the growing demands for such services.
Minor Admission Requirements
Completion of FIN 3403 with a "B" or better prior to application to the minor.
Minor Requirements
None

courseSection0.text0:
Complete at least 1 of the following: 
COP3223C - Introduction to Programming with C (3)
EGN3211 - Engineering Analysis and Computation (3)
courseSection0.text1:
Complete the following: 
COP3502C - Computer Science I (3)
FIN3403 - Business Finance (3)
courseSection0.text2: Prerequisites for FIN 3403 are waived for College of Engineering & Computer Science students
courseSection0.text3: Only one of either COP 3223C or EGN 3211 is required

p.ECO 4444 is not needed for College of En: ECO 4444 is not needed for College of Engineering & Computer Sciences students.
p.(1) Prerequisites waived for College of: (1) Prerequisites waived for College of Engineering & Computer Science students for FIN 4515, Portofolio Anaylsis and Management and FIN 4533, Financial Derivatives

li.A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all: A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
li.Grades below \"C\" or \"S\" grades from: Grades below "C" or "S" grades from other institutions are not accepted.
li.Courses taken at Florida College System: Courses taken at Florida College System institutions do not substitute for upper division courses.
li.Courses transferred must be formally eva: Courses transferred must be formally evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide a course syllabus and any other supporting information with his/her petition for this evaluation.
li.At least nine hours used in the minor mu: At least nine hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
li.Internship or Directed Research credit c: Internship or Directed Research credit cannot be used toward the minor.
li.A maximum of 6 hours of the above listed: A maximum of 6 hours of the above listed required or elective courses can count toward another major or minor degree program.

h3.Required Electives (9 hrs for Business A: Required Electives (9 hrs for Business Administration students). (6 hrs for Engineering and Computer Science students).
h3.Restricted Electives (3 hrs for CECS stu: Restricted Electives (3 hrs for CECS students. NOT required for Business Administration students)

courseSection0.header: Required Electives (9 hrs for Business Administration students). (6 hrs for Engineering and Computer Science students).
courseSection0.text:
Required Electives (9 hrs for Business Administration students). (6 hrs for Engineering and Computer Science students).
ECO 4444 - Introduction to Business Analytics for FinTech Credit Hours: 3
FIN 4450 - Foundations of FinTech Credit Hours: 3
FIN 4451 - FinTech for Decision Makers Credit Hours: 3
ECO 4444 is not needed for College of Engineering & Computer Sciences students.

Restricted Electives (3 hrs for CECS students. NOT required for Business Administration students)
Select 1:
FIN 3414 - Intermediate Corporate Finance Credit Hours: 3
FIN 3461 - Financial Statement Analysis Credit Hours: 3
FIN 4243 - Debt and Money Markets Credit Hours: 3
FIN 4324 - Commercial Bank Management Credit Hours: 3
FIN 4504 - Equity and Capital Markets Credit Hours: 3
FIN 4514 - Portfolio Analysis and Management Credit Hours: 3
FIN 4533 - Financial Derivatives Credit Hours: 3
FIN 4604 - International Financial Management Credit Hours: 3
(1) Prerequisites waived for College of Engineering & Computer Science students for FIN 4515, Portofolio Anaylsis and Management and FIN 4533, Financial Derivatives

Foreign Language Requirements
None

courseSection2.text:
Other Requirements
A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
Grades below "C" or "S" grades from other institutions are not accepted.
Courses taken at Florida College System institutions do not substitute for upper division courses.
Courses transferred must be formally evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide a course syllabus and any other supporting information with his/her petition for this evaluation.
At least nine hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
Internship or Directed Research credit cannot be used toward the minor.
A maximum of 6 hours of the above listed required or elective courses can count toward another major or minor degree program.
